### About me

Hi there! You can call me Rafik.  
I recently completed my Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science at Novosibirsk State University, and I’m now preparing to begin my Master’s and eventually a PhD. My long-term goal is to build a career in academia and research.

My academic interests revolve around Computational Natural Science, Geoinformatics, and Digital Humanities. I’m  keen on exploring how we can better understand the natural world, culture, and human behavior through new computational approaches.

Outside academia, I’m passionate about contemporary history, arts, literature, and both Eastern and Western philosophy. I love watching documentaries, exploring music—from classical to indie rock to folk traditions—and engaging in thoughtful discussions and debates. I also enjoy writing about my thoughts and experiences through blogs and short journals.

I speak English and Russian fluently, and I’m currently learning German.


Wish to talk, write me anytime!
